paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In fact, up to 25% of patients 85 years and older show ATTRwt amyloid deposits on autopsy studies.

functional_data.summary: The V122I variant is associated with increased instability of the TTR protein leading to amyloid fibril formation.

variants.additional_notes: The V122I variant is the most common mutation in the United States.
key_quotes: The most common mutation in the United States, present in 3.4% of African Americans, is V122I, in which there is an isoleucine substitution for valine at the 122nd amino acid position.

functional_data.summary: The T60A variant is associated with amyloid deposition but lacks extensive functional studies.

variants.additional_notes: The T60A variant is less common and primarily seen in specific ethnic groups.
key_quotes: The second most common mutation in the United States, T60A, is seen in patients of Irish descent.

patients.demographics: endemic areas in Portugal, Sweden, Japan, and South America

functional_data.summary: The V30M variant is well-studied and known to cause early onset of amyloidosis.

variants.additional_notes: The V30M variant is the most frequent pathogenic mutation outside the US.
key_quotes: Outside the US, the V30M is the most frequent pathogenic mutation and is especially present in endemic areas in Portugal, Sweden, Japan, and South America.

tables_processed.table_caption: Genetic variants in TTR associated with amyloidosis

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
